meanings.definition: To surpass in rivalry or competition.
meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah was outrivalling all her competitors.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard and ended up outrivalling the reigning champions.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outrivalling the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The sun was outrivalling the moon in brightness that night.
meanings.sent5: His determination was outrivalling all obstacles in his path.

meanings.definition: To be superior to in rivalry or competition.
meanings.sent1: Despite his size, the tiny ant was outrivalling the other ants in carrying food.
meanings.sent2: The student was outrivalling his classmates in solving math problems.
meanings.sent3: The cat was outrivalling the dog in catching mice around the barn.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was outrivalling her sister's in the eyes of the neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The new technology was outrivalling the old methods in efficiency.
